channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

item.title: Harris to accept historic VP nomination; Obama, Clinton and Warren among speakers at DNC's third night
The Democratic Party's short-sighted silencing of Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
AOC offers short but powerful words at DNC
item.description: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez offers short, but powerful remarks while seconding Sen. Bernie Sanders' nomination at the Democratic National Convention.

item.title: Here's what happened when students went to school during the 1918 pandemic
A continent by continent look at where the pandemic stands
The White House has stopped even pretending Trump won't contest the election results
Evacuation orders issued as more than 360 wildfires scorch California
Flood waters reached the toes of this famous giant Buddha statue for the first time in decades
item.description: Floods in southern China have caused water from the Yangtze River to reach the toes of a famous gigantic statue of the Buddha -- reportedly for the first time in decades.

item.title: Taiwan to ban Chinese streaming services
item.description: Taiwan is preparing to ban iQiyi and Tencent from operating streaming video services on the island, the latest in a series of moves by governments around the world against Chinese tech giants.

item.title: The US Senate just dropped a massive Russia bombshell (and most people missed it)
item.description: On Tuesday, the Senate Intelligence Committee dropped a bombshell about Russia's interference in the 2016 election -- and its ongoing efforts to disrupt the 2020 contest as well.

item.title: Apple is now worth $2 trillion
item.description: Among its many accomplishments -- the iPhone, the iPad, iTunes, the App store -- Apple can now boast of one more: It is now worth more than $2 trillion, making it the first company in the United States to reach that milestone.

item.title: Trump 'cancels' Goodyear tires as he campaigns against 'cancel culture'
item.description: President Donald Trump is calling on his followers to not buy Goodyear tires, despite previously railing against "cancel culture," after an employee posted a viral photo of a company policy banning "Make America Great Again" and other political attire in the workplace.

item.title: Carl Bernstein talks mail-in voting and the USPS
item.description: Anderson Cooper talks to legendary journalist Carl Bernstein about the threat to mail-in voting and the USPS. Watch Anderson Cooper Full Circle every Monday, Tuesday and Friday at 6p E.T.

item.title: Bolsonaro says the Amazon isn't on fire. Here's a photo of a fire in the Amazon
Why the Mali coup could worry Trump and Macron
item.description: A coup in Mali, West Africa, could have ramifications far beyond its borders, threatening to further destabilize across the region and jeopardizing counter-insurgency efforts led by France and the United States.

item.title: Trump endorsed a candidate who calls herself a 'proud Islamophobe'
item.description: If you've paid attention to the rise of the radical right on the internet over the last few years, you know the name Laura Loomer.

item.title: Late-night have their say on Michelle Obama's DNC speech
item.description: Late-night hosts lauded Michelle Obama's Democratic National Convention speech as she calls out Donald Trump.

item.title: 'The nightmare has ended': Victims address the Golden State Killer in court
item.description: Nearly every victim who took the stand against the Golden State Killer on Tuesday called him a monster -- one they were finally able to face after decades of waiting.

item.title: Series of Berlin highway crashes are 'suspected Islamist act,' say prosecutors
item.description: Police in Germany have arrested a 30-year-old man whom they say caused a series of motorway incidents in Berlin, in what prosecutors say is a "suspected Islamist act."

item.title: Anderson Cooper clashes with MyPillow creator: How do you sleep at night?
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper grills "MyPillow" creator Mike Lindell regarding his claims that oleandrin is a potential therapeutic for coronavirus.

item.title: Police officer freed by firefighters after getting stuck in his own handcuffs
item.description: A British police officer needed to be rescued by firefighters after getting his hands stuck in a pair of handcuffs.

item.title: 750M genetically engineered mosquitoes approved for release in Florida Keys
item.description: A plan to release millions of genetically modified mosquitoes in 2021 has won final approval from authorities in the Florida Keys, despite the objection of many local residents and a coalition of environmental advocacy groups.

item.title: How a village grandmother became a YouTube sensation
item.description: It has become a common phenomenon in the digital age: undiscovered talent finds fame online. But this tech-centric, rags-to-riches story isn't quite the same, because Gangavva Milkuri is not your typical YouTube star.

item.title: 10 more eggs harvested from the only two northern white rhinos left in the world
item.description: Scientists in Kenya found success once again in harvesting eggs from the only two northern white rhinos worldwide, furthering the initiative to save the animal from extinction.

item.title: What's happening in Belarus explained
item.description: Belarus' newly re-elected president Alexander Lukashenko is facing increased pressure to resign as tens of thousands of people are taking the streets to protest the disputed presidential election.

item.title: A Breonna Taylor billboard was vandalized with red paint
item.description: A billboard calling for action in the killing of Breonna Taylor was vandalized with red paint on Tuesday in her hometown of Louisville, Kentucky.

item.title: New footage raises questions over encounter between sheriff's deputy and NBA team boss
item.description: Dramatic new footage has emerged of the altercation between Toronto Raptors' president, Masai Ujiri, and a San Francisco Bay Area police officer, following the Canadian team's decisive game 6 victory in the NBA Finals last year.

item.title: Rare footage shows US patrol of South China Sea
item.description: For the first time in two years, the US Navy is providing CNN with rare footage and interviews aboard a reconnaissance plane flying over the contested South China Sea. The pandemic has not stopped the rising tensions between the US and Chinese Navies, as well as warships of neighboring countries that claim parts of region. CNN's Ivan Watson reports.

item.title: SpaceX is now a $46 billion 'unicorn'
item.description: SpaceX, the Elon Musk-led company that recently became the first business in history to send astronauts into Earth's orbit, is parlaying its successes into big money.

item.title: Duffer brothers talk future of 'Stranger Things'
item.description: Season 4 of "Stranger Things" won't be the end of the show.

item.title: A tiny 'elephant' has been rediscovered in Africa
item.description: Scientists found an elephant shrew, or Somali sengi, in Djibouti for the first time in 50 years.

item.title: This 'ghost kitchen' cooks food for over 100 restaurants
item.description: If you live in a city and you feel hungry, the chances are you can browse a selection of your favorite restaurants on your cell phone and, before long, someone will be at your door delivering freshly made food.

item.title: World Photography Day: 5 of the year's best photo stories
item.description: With Wednesday marking World Photography Day 2020, CNN Style is looking back at some of the most striking photo series published over the past 12 months.

item.title: Honey may be better at treating coughs and colds than over-the-counter medicines
item.description: Honey may be a better treatment for coughs and colds than over-the-counter medicines, a new study has found.

item.title: So you want to quit vaping? Read this to do it for good
item.description: There is no denying that vaping is popular among teens, with one-third of US high school students reporting they have vaped or used other electronic nicotine products recently, according to a 2019 study.

item.title: Meet the artist who paints with her eyes
item.description: London-based artist Sarah Ezekiel has won international recognition for her vivid, life-affirming images. But her work is all the more remarkable for the fact that she has a medical condition that has left her unable to move her arms.

item.title: Why people talk to chatbots in times of trouble
item.description: During the depths of winter, temperatures in Burlington, Vermont, a state in the US Northeast, can drop far below freezing. Blizzards howl and the snow creeps up to knee level.

item.title: Paris Hilton opens up about childhood trauma in new documentary
item.description: HLN's Melissa Knowles reports on an upcoming documentary about Paris Hilton and it's new trailer that hints at Hilton opening up about childhood trauma.

item.title: Lionel Messi is 'pillar' of new Barca project
item.description: Amid fevered speculation that Lionel Messi's days at Barcelona are numbered, the club's president has insisted his star playmaker is going nowhere.

item.title: Blind musician can feel conductor's movements, thanks to high-tech baton
item.description: When Kyungho Jeon was young, he dreamed of playing in an orchestra, but his teachers feared it would be too difficult -- not because he lacked musical talent, but because he was born blind, and couldn't see a conductor's movements to follow their cues.

item.title: White and wondering why you can't use the N-word? Watch this
item.description: CNN received this question from a viewer: "Why can Black people say the N-word, but White people can't?" It's a loaded question. CNN's Darryl Forges explains.

item.title: League of Legends is growing. Traditional sports better watch out
item.description: With its millions of viewers, lucrative titles and sell-out competitions, it should come as no surprise that the world of esports is beginning to challenge some of Europe's most established sports.

item.title: Lavender sales are surging during the coronavirus pandemic
item.description: Lavender sales are surging as people seek relief from stress and sleep deprivation during the pandemic.

item.title: The short-sighted silencing of Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
item.description: • Opinion: AOC showed she's Dems' future • AOC slams NBC News for misleading tweet • LIVE: Barack Obama leads speaker list for DNC's third night

item.title: A message to progressives: This could be Biden's LBJ moment
item.description: In 2020, crisis abounds. The Covid-19 pandemic has taken over 170,000 American lives, and destroyed millions of livelihoods. In the second quarter alone, the American economy contracted by a third -- nearly four times worse than the worst quarter of the Great Depression. Meanwhile, one poll found that nearly 9% of Americans came onto the streets for the movement for Black Lives, calling for an end to systemic racism -- though politicians have yet to deliver real, lasting policy change. And Donald Trump has taken a fresh run at defiling America's democratic and cultural institutions and norms, driving public mistrust in government to an almost historic low.

item.title: More prominent Republicans have officially backed Biden
item.description: A number of prominent Republicans have endorsed Joe Biden's presidential bid, handing the former vice president potentially useful support as he looks to win over dissatisfied members of the party.

item.title: Fact-checking the first two nights of the Democratic convention
item.description: To be frank, there hasn't been a whole lot to fact-check from the Democratic National Convention so far.

item.title: Army investigating presence of uniformed soldiers at DNC
item.description: The appearance of two uniformed Army soldiers during a presentation at the Democratic National Convention on Tuesday appears to have violated a Department of Defense policy about military personnel participating in political events, raising new concerns about the politicization of the military in the political campaign season.

item.title: Here's what happened when students went to school during the 1918 pandemic
item.description: • LIVE: A continent by continent look at where the pandemic stands • Person may have exposed others at a bar during massive motorcycle rally

item.title: Video shows huge pool party in Wuhan
item.description: Thousands of partygoers gathered in an open air water park for an electronic music festival in Wuhan, China, once the "ground zero" of the coronavirus pandemic.
